app

You could first determine the mean and standard deviation of the Bernoulli variable \(X\).

\[\mu = p = 0.41\] \[\sigma = \sqrt{p(1-p)} = 0.491833\]


  1. Identify the boundary.\[\hat{p}=0.5078\]Calculate the standard error (of proportion sampling)\[\text{SE} = \frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{n}}=\sqrt{\frac{p(1-p)}{n}} =0.061479\]Get the z score.\[z=\frac{\hat{p}-\mu}{\text{SE}}=1.59\]With \(z\)-table, determine \(P(Z>1.59)=0.0559\)
  2. Identify the boundary.\[\sum x=16.5\]Calculate the standard error (of total)\[\text{SE} = \sigma\sqrt{n}=\sqrt{np(1-p)} =2.951\]Get the z score.\[z=\frac{\sum x-n\mu}{\text{SE}}=0.59\]With \(z\)-table, determine \(P(Z<0.59)=0.7224\)
  3. Identify the boundary.\[\hat{p}=0.4877\]Calculate the standard error (of proportion sampling)\[\text{SE} = \frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{n}}= \sqrt{\frac{p(1-p)}{n}} = 0.054648\]Get the z score.\[z=\frac{\hat{p}-\mu}{\text{SE}}=1.42\]With \(z\)-table, determine \(P(Z<1.42)=0.9222\)
  4. Identify the boundary.\[\sum x=20.5\]Calculate the standard error (of total)\[\text{SE} = \sigma\sqrt{n}=\sqrt{np(1-p)} =3.4428\]Get the z score.\[z=\frac{\sum x-n\mu}{\text{SE}}=0.12\]With \(z\)-table, determine \(P(Z>0.12)=0.4522\)
